question: Will Rihanna, Jay-Z and/or Beyonce appear at the Super Bowl halftime show in 2025?
fine_print: Any appearance will count, including remotely or pre-recorded, as long as it is during the halftime show on the official broadcast.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Janet Jackson, Beyoncé and Rihanna gave us unforgettable Super Bowl halftime moments: Look back in photos at the stars and their performances**
The Super Bowl halftime show has evolved from a simple mix of marching bands and variety acts to a spectacle that delivers unforgettable moments, cultural milestones, and controversy. Over the years, performances by Carol Channing, Bob Hope, Michael Jackson, Madonna, Janet Jackson, Britney Spears, and others have captured the spirit of their era. This year, Kendrick Lamar will take the stage at Super Bowl LIX, fresh off five Grammy wins, including Record of the Year and Song of the Year for 'Not Like Us.' Before Lamar's performance, take a look back at some of the most memorable Super Bowl halftime performances of all time.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 06, 2025 01:03 PM
Source:[Yahoo](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/janet-jackson-beyonce-and-rihanna-gave-us-unforgettable-super-bowl-halftime-moments-look-back-in-photos-at-the-stars-and-their-performances-130018253.html)

**Super Bowl Halftime Show 2025: Kendrick Lamar predictions for songs, surprise guests**
Kendrick Lamar will perform at the Super Bowl Halftime Show 2025 on February 9, 2025, at the Caesars Superdome in New Orleans. Fans are speculating about surprise guests, with Taylor Swift being a top contender due to her relationship with Travis Kelce, a player for the Kansas City Chiefs, and her past collaboration with Lamar on the song 'Bad Blood.' According to a survey of 3,000 NFL fans, the top 10 surprise guest predictions for the Halftime Show are: U2, ASAP Rocky, 2Chainz, Rihanna, Drake, Lil Wayne, Dr. Dre, Taylor Swift, Beyoncé, and the number one prediction is not specified. 'It's almost certain that Taylor Swift will be in attendance,' said the article, 'seeing as she's dating Travis Kelce, who plays tight end for the Chiefs.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2025 09:27 PM
Source:[attractionsmagazine.com](https://attractionsmagazine.com/super-bowl-halftime-show-2025-kendrick-lamar-2/)

**Who Had the Best Super Bowl Halftime Show: Beyoncé, Shakira, or Rihanna?**
The Super Bowl halftime show is one of the most anticipated events worldwide, featuring talented artists selected by the National Football League (NFL). For the 2025 edition, Kendrick Lamar will perform on February 9 at the Caesars Dome in New Orleans. We review the performances of three incredible artists: Beyoncé, Shakira, and Rihanna. Beyoncé's 2013 show in the Mercedes-Benz Superdome in New Orleans began with her hit 'Crazy in Love' and featured a reunion with her former Destiny's Child bandmates Kelly Rowland and Michelle Williams. The show included flames, fireworks, lights, a large stage with many dancers, smoke, and a grand choreography, leaving the audience without power for over half an hour. Rihanna, pregnant with her second child, performed at the 2023 Super Bowl halftime show, starting with a presentation that featured her biggest hits, including 'Bitch Better Have My Money', 'Where Have You Been', 'Rude Boy', and 'Work'. Shakira, accompanied by Jennifer López, delivered an impressive performance, showcasing her strength, attitude, and Latin flavor. She also demonstrated her talent by playing the guitar and drums. The celebration of football was complemented by two of the biggest names in urban music, Colombian J Balvin and Puerto Rican Bad Bunny, making it a proud night for Hispanics.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 05, 2025 08:20 PM
Source:[meridiano.net](https://meridiano.net/usa/farandula/rihanna-shakira-y-beyonce-quien-ha-tenido-el-mejor-super-bowl--20252516200)

**Super Bowl 2025: How to Watch the Kendrick Lamar and SZA Halftime Show**
Kendrick Lamar will be the headliner for the Super Bowl 2025 halftime show, which will also feature SZA. Lamar has won 17 Grammys, including five for his song 'Not Like Us', a diss track aimed at Drake. SZA appeared on Lamar's recent album and performed with him at the 2022 Super Bowl. The performance is expected to be flashy and will be around 15-20 minutes long. According to The Mirror, Apple Music and the NFL spend $10 million on sets, staff and more for the halftime show. Despite not getting paid, the Super Bowl halftime performers gain increased visibility and can make money through increased music sales and streaming. Rihanna's performance at the 2023 Super Bowl led to a 640 percent increase in her music on Spotify. The Super Bowl will be played on February 9, 2025, at 6:30 p.m. ET, and will be broadcast nationally on Fox and available to stream for free on Tubi.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2025 07:40 PM
Source:[CNET](https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/whos-performing-at-super-bowl-halftime-show-kendrick-lamar-sza-how-to-watch-set-list-pay/)

**Kendrick Lamar Super Bowl halftime show 2025: Surprise guest and setlist predictions**
Kendrick Lamar is set to headline the Super Bowl halftime show in 2025, and while the setlist is still a secret, it's been confirmed that SZA will join him on stage. SZA, who is a frequent collaborator of Lamar's, said, 'That's King Kendrick's performance and that it is all for him to divulge,' but did reveal that Lamar has 'worked really hard on it, and I'm so honored to be a part of it.' Other potential guests have been rumored, including Oasis and Kero Kero Bonito, but these have been denied by the artists themselves. A recent poll found that fans most want to see Eminem, Beyoncé, and Taylor Swift join Lamar on stage. Lamar's setlist is expected to include his Grammy-winning song 'Not Like Us.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 07:47 PM
Source:[The Independent](https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/kendrick-lamar-super-bowl-halftime-show-surprise-guests-setlist-b2692152.html)

**16 songs Kendrick Lamar should perform during the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show**
For The Win has curated a list of 16 songs that Kendrick Lamar could perform during the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show. The list includes 'Not Like Us', 'squabble up', 'tv off' (feat. Lefty Gunplay), and other popular tracks. While some of these songs may not actually be performed, the list provides a glimpse into what could be an 'immaculate' show. According to the article, the setlist is currently unknown, but it's likely that Kendrick will bring 'some heat' to the stage. The list also includes collaborations with SZA, Taylor Swift, Jay Rock, Future, James Blake, and Beyoncé.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 05:21 PM
Source:[For The Win](https://ftw.usatoday.com/lists/super-bowl-2025-kendrick-lamar-halftime-show-setlist-prediction)

**2025 Super Bowl halftime show: Who's performing? Latest list**
The 2025 Super Bowl halftime show will feature Kendrick Lamar and SZA, who will perform at the NFL's championship game for the first time. Lamar, a 20-time Grammy winner, said he's looking forward to bringing hip-hop to the Super Bowl, where he previously performed as a guest artist in 2022. The duo will be joined by Grammy winner SZA, who appeared on Lamar's recent album 'GNX.' The halftime show will be co-executive produced by Jay-Z's Roc Nation company and Emmy-winning producer Jesse Collins. Lamar and SZA will also co-headline a 19-city North American tour this spring and summer. The Super Bowl LIX will take place in New Orleans at the Caesars Superdome on Sunday, Feb. 9, with kickoff set for 5:30 p.m. and airing on Fox. The pregame performances will feature Louisiana natives, including Jon Batiste singing the national anthem, Trombone Shorty and Lauren Daigle performing 'America the Beautiful,' and Ledisi performing 'Lift Every Voice and Sing.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 05:45 PM
Source:[nbcchicago.com](https://www.nbcchicago.com/entertainment/entertainment-news/2025-super-bowl-halftime-show-latest-list-of-performers/3663646/)

**Super Bowl 59 halftime show: Predicting Kendrick Lamar's setlist and guest performers - CBSSports.com**
Kendrick Lamar is set to headline the Super Bowl 59 halftime show, and CBS Sports has made predictions about his setlist and guest performers. Lamar will perform 'Not Like Us' and 'All The Stars' with SZA, and possibly 'Hey Now' with Tyler, The Creator. Baby Keem and Black Hippy, featuring ScHoolboy Q, Jay Rock, and Ab-Soul, will also make appearances. A New Orleans native, such as Master P or the Hot Boyz, may be incorporated into the performance to pay homage to the city. Jazz icons like Robert Glasper, Terrace Martin, and Kamasi Washington may also make cameos. The show could end with a performance of 'Bad Blood' by Kendrick Lamar and Taylor Swift, although this is a long shot. Other possible guest performers include Beyonce, Rihanna, Dr. Dre, and Pharrell.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 01:08 PM
Source:[CBS Sports](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/super-bowl-59-halftime-show-predicting-kendrick-lamars-setlist-and-guest-performers/)

**Super Bowl halftime show: Who is performing, when to watch and how to stream**
Kendrick Lamar will headline the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show, joined by his longtime collaborator SZA. Lamar was announced as the performer in September by Jay-Z, who praised the rapper as 'a once-in-a-generation artist and performer.' The halftime show will take place between 8 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. EST, and will be broadcast on Fox and live-streamed for free on Tubi. Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste will perform the national anthem, while Lauren Daigle and Trombone Shorty will perform 'America the Beautiful.'
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 07:22 AM
Source:[Yahoo](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/kendrick-lamar-joined-r-b-214841082.html)

**Every Super Bowl halftime performer in history: Kendrick Lamar, Rihanna, Prince, Beyonce and more - CBSSports.com**
The Super Bowl halftime show has evolved over the years, from its early days of featuring college marching bands and flag-spinning tributes to the current must-see performances by top artists. The list of previous Super Bowl halftime performers and themes includes notable acts such as Michael Jackson, Prince, Beyonce, and Kendrick Lamar. In 2024, Usher headlined the Apple Music Super Bowl LVIII Halftime Show in Las Vegas, while Kendrick Lamar will perform as a headliner in 2025 with special guest SZA. The article highlights the growth of the halftime show and its impact on popular culture, with many performances becoming iconic moments in music history.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 03, 2025 02:08 PM
Source:[CBS Sports](https://www.cbssports.com/nfl/news/every-super-bowl-halftime-performer-in-history-kendrick-lamar-rihanna-prince-beyonce-and-more/)

**Super Bowl 2025 halftime show guide: Who's performing and the big controversy that can't be avoided**
The Super Bowl LIX halftime show will feature hip-hop superstar Kendrick Lamar as the headline act, with fellow Grammy-winning artist SZA joining him as a special guest performer. The show is expected to start around 12pm AEDT on Monday, February 10, and will last around 13 minutes. Lamar's performance has been surrounded by controversy, with local right-wing politicians declaring the show must be 'family-friendly' due to past performances by Rihanna and concerns about Lamar's feud with Drake, which is central to his recent album 'Not Like Us'. Drake has launched a lawsuit against Lamar for 'falsely accusing him of being a sex offender' and is also suing his own record label. Lamar has previously performed at the Super Bowl in 2022 as a guest in the halftime show headlined by Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg. 'We realise that these past vulgar performances may have been acceptable to the residents of those states where those Super Bowls were held but, in Louisiana, these lewd acts are inappropriate for viewing by children, objectify women, and are simply NOT welcomed by the majority of Louisiana parents,' said local right-wing politicians. Lamar's setlist is expected to include songs from his recent album, as well as possible surprise guests, including Lil Wayne, Baby Keem, Future, Metro Boomin, Jay Rock, Doechii, and Travis Scott.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 02, 2025 11:51 AM
Source:[Fox Sports](https://www.foxsports.com.au/nfl/superbowl/super-bowl-2025-halftime-show-kendrick-lamar-list-of-songs-to-be-performed-drake-controversy-start-time-aedt-when-is-the-super-bowl-lix-half-time-show/news-story/ac460d829f5aae0a040f2da59c58a62d)

**Louisiana lawmakers demand 'family-friendly' halftime shows ahead of Super Bowl 2025, slam Rihanna, J. Lo as 'lewd'**
A group of 17 Republican Louisiana legislators have sent a letter to the Greater New Orleans Sports Foundation and the Louisiana Stadium and Expo District demanding a 'family-friendly' Super Bowl halftime show ahead of Super Bowl 2025. They slammed previous performances from Rihanna and Jennifer Lopez as 'lewd' and 'offensive', citing their 'vulgar' acts as examples of what they consider unacceptable for children. The legislators argue that taxpayers should have a say in the event since the state government contributes money to it. They have called out Rihanna's performance for 'groping herself' and Lopez's for 'wearing little clothing and being groped by dancers on stage.' The letter also requests that future contracts for the halftime event ensure that performers adhere to Louisiana's community decency standards. This year's halftime performer, Kendrick Lamar, has been asked to ensure that his performance is 'family-friendly'.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 30, 2025 03:05 AM
Source:[Entertainment Weekly](https://ew.com/louisiana-lawmakers-demand-family-friendly-halftime-shows-ahead-of-super-bowl-2025-slam-rihanna-jlo-as-lewd-8782878)

**SZA to Join Kendrick Lamar for Super Bowl Halftime Show**
Kendrick Lamar has invited SZA to be a guest artist during his halftime show at the Super Bowl on February 9. The Super Bowl halftime show is one of the most-watched television events in the US. SZA and Lamar have collaborated on several occasions, including the song 'All the Stars' for the 2018 film 'Black Panther', for which they both received nominations for Best Original Song at the Golden Globes and Oscars. They have also appeared on each other's albums. This is not the first time Lamar has performed at the Super Bowl, as he was a guest artist during Dr. Dre's halftime show in 2022, alongside Eminem, Snoop Dogg, and 50 Cent. Last year, Usher performed during the halftime show, while previous performers have included Rihanna, Jennifer Lopez, Prince, Beyoncé, Lady Gaga, and Madonna.
Original language: nl
Publish date: January 25, 2025 01:35 PM
Source:[dbsuriname.com](https://www.dbsuriname.com/2025/01/25/sza-te-zien-als-gastartieste-bij-super-bowl-optreden-van-kendrick-lamar/)

**Who is Super Bowl 59 halftime show performer? What to know about Kendrick Lamar**
Kendrick Lamar will headline the 2025 Apple Music Super Bowl halftime show at Caesars Superdome in New Orleans on Feb. 9. Lamar, a 17-time Grammy Award and Pulitzer Prize winner, has assured he's the 'right one' for the job, citing rap music as the most impactful genre to date. This is not his first rodeo, as he made a guest appearance in the Super Bowl 56 halftime show in 2022. Lamar's set list is usually a closely guarded secret, but it's likely he'll perform his Grammy-nominated record 'Not Like Us,' which he performed five consecutive times during his 'The Pop Out: Ken & Friends' concert last year. Special guests, including SZA, Taylor Swift, Jay-Z, Beyonce, Travis Scott, and Rihanna, may also make an appearance. The announcement drew mixed reactions, with some expressing disappointment over the alleged snub of rapper Lil Wayne, a native New Orleans. However, Lil Wayne has wished Lamar 'all the best' and told him to 'kill it' during the performance.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 13, 2025 07:56 PM
Source:[Yahoo](https://www.yahoo.com/entertainment/super-bowl-59-halftime-show-194624163.html)

**Universitario de Deportes to Host Super Bowl-Inspired Halftime Show**
Universitario de Deportes, the current national champion, and Inter Miami, led by Lionel Messi, will play an exhibition match with a halftime show inspired by the Super Bowl. This will be the first time in Peruvian football history that an event will feature a halftime show in the style of the Super Bowl. The show will include performances by renowned national and international artists, such as the Argentine band La T y la M'. The event will be organized by Sound Music Entertainment and Long Play Entertainment, and the proceeds will go towards improving the club's High-Performance Center (CAR). Universitario has managed to secure a special benefit for its members and fans who purchased tickets for the Noche Crema 2025 event. The club thanked its loyal fans for their support and invited them to be part of this unforgettable night, which reinforces their commitment to providing top-level entertainment. 'This will be an unprecedented event that will mark the history of our club,' said the club. 'We are excited to bring this experience to our fans and to the Peruvian football community,' added Universitario. The Super Bowl is the final game of the National Football League (NFL) championship, where the champions of the National Conference (NFC) and the American Conference (AFC) face off. The game is broadcast on the second Sunday of February and is one of the most-watched television events in the United States. It has featured performances by international artists such as Whitney Houston, Mariah Carey, Celine Dion, Beyoncé, Lady Gaga, and Rihanna.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 10, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[andina.pe](https://andina.pe/agencia/noticia-de-lujo-partido-u-vs-inter-tendra-show-medio-tiempo-al-estilo-del-super-bowl-1014511.aspx)

**Beyoncé vs. Rihanna: The Great Halftime Show Debate**
Beyoncé's recent halftime show during the Texans vs. Ravens game has sparked a heated debate on social media, with some users comparing it to Rihanna's iconic show at the 2023 Super Bowl. The presentation, streamed exclusively on Netflix on December 25, 2024, has been criticized for its supposed similarities in design and execution with Rihanna's show. Beyoncé's performance, which took place at the NRG Stadium in Houston, included songs from her album 'Cowboy Carter' and featured special guests like Post Malone, Shaboozey, and her 12-year-old daughter Blue Ivy. However, users on social media began pointing out parallels between Beyoncé's stage design and Rihanna's presentation while she was pregnant. Some users commented, 'Rihanna's influence is inevitable' and 'It seems like Beyoncé hired the same stylist and choreographer who worked with Rihanna.' Others questioned the originality of Beyoncé's concept, suggesting that the show was directly inspired by Rihanna's. Despite the criticism, some users defended Beyoncé, arguing that her talent is superior to Rihanna's and that there's no room for comparison. They also pointed out that Beyoncé has always innovated in her performances and that any similarities could be a coincidence or a shared artistic decision. As one fan replied, 'Take a break and take your formula.' It's worth noting that collaborations in the entertainment industry are common, and artists often work with the same creatives. Many users speculate that Beyoncé may have hired the team of stylists and choreographers who previously worked with Rihanna, which could explain some of the similarities.
Original language: es
Publish date: December 26, 2024 11:33 PM
Source:[EL IMPARCIAL | Noticias de México y el mundo](https://www.elimparcial.com/espectaculos/2024/12/26/beyonce-le-copio-a-rihanna-comparan-el-show-de-la-nfl-de-ambas-artistas/)

**Beyoncé vs Rihanna: The Great Halftime Show Debate**
Beyoncé's recent halftime show during the Texans vs Ravens game has sparked a heated debate on social media, with some users comparing it to Rihanna's iconic show at the 2023 Super Bowl. The presentation, which was exclusively streamed on Netflix on December 25, 2024, has been criticized for its supposed similarities in design and execution to Rihanna's show. Beyoncé's performance, which took place at the NRG Stadium in Houston, included songs from her album 'Cowboy Carter' and featured special guests like Post Malone, Shaboozey, and her 12-year-old daughter Blue Ivy. However, some users on social media began to point out parallels between Beyoncé's stage design and Rihanna's presentation while she was pregnant. **Did Beyoncé Copy Rihanna's Super Bowl Halftime Show? Fans Think So**
Fans are debating whether Beyoncé's recent halftime show performance was inspired by Rihanna's 2023 Super Bowl show. Some pointed out similarities in the stage design, with one fan noting that Beyoncé hired the same stylist and choreographer as Rihanna's 2023 performance. However, others defended Beyoncé, saying that the platform used in her performance was not new or unique, and that she has been using similar elements in her shows for years. The debate has sparked a heated discussion among fans, with some accusing the 'navy' (Rihanna's dedicated fan base) of being 'insecure and filled with hate' for downplaying Beyoncé's performance. Dave Portnoy also weighed in, saying that Beyoncé has been 'lost since Destiny's Child' and that Rihanna is superior.
Original language: en
Publish date: December 26, 2024 06:14 PM
Source:[musictimes.com](https://www.musictimes.com/articles/107167/20241226/did-beyonce-copy-rihannas-super-bowl-halftime-show-fans-think-so.htm)

**Dave Portnoy was not a fan of Beyoncé’s NFL Christmas halftime show: ‘Been LOST’**
Dave Portnoy, the founder of Barstool Sports, expressed his disappointment with Beyoncé's Christmas Day halftime show performance, stating that she 'has been LOST since Destinys Child.' Portnoy believes that Beyoncé hasn't delivered much in over a decade, despite her high-production show featuring hits from her Cowboy Carter album and appearances from other artists. This isn't the first time Portnoy has held this opinion, as he also preferred Rihanna's halftime show at Super Bowl 2023. Beyoncé has been a popular fixture for the NFL, performing at the 2013 Super Bowl and appearing as a guest star alongside Bruno Mars and Coldplay three years later. Her husband, Jay-Z, has a relationship with the NFL, producing entertainment for the league, including the Super Bowl halftime show.
Original language: en
Publish date: December 26, 2024 02:27 AM
Source:[nypost.com](https://nypost.com/2024/12/25/sports/dave-portnoy-was-not-a-fan-of-beyonces-nfl-halftime-show/?itm_source=parsely-api)

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, high-profile artists such as Rihanna, Jay-Z, and Beyonce have been invited to perform at prestigious events like the Super Bowl halftime show. Each of them has previously participated in such events, which increases the likelihood of them being chosen again. The Super Bowl halftime show is known for featuring top-tier artists with significant popularity and influence. Since 2010, major artists have participated in the show approximately 70% of the time when eligible. Given that all three artists fit this profile, a base rate of 70% is used for at least one appearing in 2025.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Popularity and Relevance
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: As of the latest data in 2025, all three artists remain highly popular and relevant in the music industry. Their involvement in recent projects or music releases often correlates with their selection for televised events, further supported by ongoing media presence. Thus, their current status boosts the probability.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Historical Scheduling Patterns
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Artists who have already headlined the halftime show are occasionally featured again in supporting or surprise appearances. Rihanna and Beyonce have not been main performers recently, while Jay-Z has significant influence in entertainment circles, suggesting a collective likelihood of one or more appearing, boosting the probability.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Potential Conflicting Engagements
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: These artists are often engaged in global tours or other commitments around the same time as the Super Bowl. Known for their busy schedules and high demand, potential conflicts could reduce availability, slightly decreasing the probability.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Beyonce and Rihanna are listed as potential surprise guests in several speculative articles and polls regarding Kendrick Lamar's halftime performance. The fact that they are frequently mentioned as potential guests highlights their continued relevance and potential involvement, reinforcing the initial high probability.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Definitive information from the sources provided indicates that the main performers for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show will be Kendrick Lamar and SZA, which reduces the likelihood of appearances by other major artists like Rihanna, Jay-Z, or Beyonce.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, celebrity performers, especially those with significant influence in the music industry, have been a staple of the Super Bowl halftime show. The involvement of artists like Rihanna, Jay-Z, or Beyoncé is plausible since each of them has had a long-standing presence in the music scene and substantial public appeal. The Super Bowl often features high-profile artists to attract viewers and boost ratings. Beyoncé has performed at the Super Bowl halftime show before, increasing the likelihood of a repeat appearance. For the initial probability, I will consider this historical frequency and the cultural relevance of these artists, estimating a base rate of approximately 30%. This base rate reflects both the general trend of inviting top-tier music celebrities and the specific status of these artists.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Past Super Bowl Performances
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Beyoncé has performed at the Super Bowl halftime show in 2013 and made a guest appearance in 2016. Artists who have participated in the show before are often considered for future events, increasing the probability of their return.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Recent Media Presence
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: As a publicist, understanding media presence is crucial. Recently, Rihanna and Beyoncé have been absent from major performances due to personal and professional commitments (e.g., Rihanna's focus on her business ventures and Beyoncé's family time). Their absence might decrease the likelihood of their participation in live performances such as the Super Bowl.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Strategic Collaborations
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Jay-Z is in a strategic partnership with the NFL, which enhances the probability of their related artists participating, as part of branding and business strategies to strengthen their affiliations.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several news articles mentioned the history of Beyoncé and Rihanna's Super Bowl performances, and the speculation surrounding surprise guests like Beyoncé at Kendrick Lamar's show. Jay-Z's involvement with the NFL and halftime show production as highlighted in the articles supports the potential for these artists' inclusion.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: It's confirmed that Kendrick Lamar and SZA will headline the Super Bowl 2025 halftime show, with no concrete evidence of additional headliners like Rihanna, Jay-Z, or Beyoncé. The emphasis on family-friendly performance and controversies surrounding previous shows featuring Rihanna decreases the likelihood.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, major artists like Rihanna, Jay-Z, and Beyonce have frequently headlined or appeared in the Super Bowl halftime show. Given the high profile of these artists, the probability of any one or more of them appearing in a given Super Bowl show is relatively significant. Since 2000, major headliner artists often return to the Super Bowl every 5-10 years, either as main acts or special guests. Based on this turn-around frequency and the current cultural status of these artists, a starting base rate of 30% seems reasonable, considering the relative attractiveness of their past performances and potential contractual interests with event organizers.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Artist popularity and global reach
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Rihanna, Jay-Z, and Beyonce are globally recognized figures with extensive follower bases, making them advantageous choices for high-viewership events like the Super Bowl, which seeks to maximize audience engagement and ad revenues. Their participation would likely result in increased viewership ratings, incentivizing the NFL and sponsors to secure them for the event.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Prior collaborations with the NFL
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Jay-Z's known involvement with the NFL through his partnership with Roc Nation to advise on and produce the entertainment for Super Bowl Halftime shows increases the probability of appearances by him or closely affiliated artists like Beyonce or Rihanna. This ongoing collaboration keeps them strategically positioned to headline or make appearances.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Competition from emerging artists
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The entertainment industry continually introduces new talents that may present fresh and appealing alternatives for the Super Bowl audience. The NFL might opt for newer acts to attract younger demographics and maintain cultural relevance. This could decrease the chance for artists who have previously performed.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Several articles speculate about surprise guests for the 2025 Super Bowl halftime show, with mentions of Beyonce, Rihanna, and Jay-Z as potential guests, which supports the notion that they are considered high-caliber guests and have potential involvement.
